extendedInfo.description: NB: Please note that an additional download of 325MB is required once this app has been installed. Please ensure you use a WiFi connection to prevent additional data costs.Michael Morcombe's Field Guide to Australian Birds has been called the most comprehensive field guide to Australian birds in the market today and now it is perfectly complimented by the eGuide which features:â Optimised controls â swipe to next or previous species, one-tap enlargement of an image and rotate the device (landscape) to enlarge an image completely (and fit the width of the screen).â Over 3000 hi-res bird images covering over 790 bird species.â Most bird species have a detailed distribution map showing any subspecies that occur.â Detailed text descriptions of almost all bird species including songs and calls, measurements and breeding behaviour.â Over 1800 carefully-selected and edited sound recordings for over 600 species. Many species are represented with multiple call examples showing the full range of vocalizations.â The ability to compare any two images, maps, or sounds, side by side on the screen.â The ability to filter by geographic location, so that you see only the species likely to occur in your location, and to further reduce the possibilities to usual or vagrant species in the selected area.â A "Smart Search" that gives the ability to search by distinguishing features such as size, colour, physical features, habitat and exclude certain types of birds (eg. Passerines).â *A basic personal species list that stores your sightings saved to the device (ability to upload list coming soon)â A comprehensive help and introduction section to help you if you get stuck or donât understand how a certain feature works.* Uninstalling/reinstalling the program will result in the loss of your list, it is recommended that you keep a backup from the application (My List -> Export).We invite all users to share their comments and ideas on our forum at www.mydigitalearth.com

reviews.title: 15 minute refund period?
reviews.comment: Having a 15 minute refund period on a product that takes at least 30 minutes to load all its files before it\'s usable is rather dubious ethically.
reviews.author: John Stevens

reviews.title: Great app, no alternative for Australian ornithologists
reviews.comment: It seems expensive, as much as an ebook, but the extra features make it worthwhile, particularly the calls. The hand drawn maps in particular don\'t give it a slick feel, but are in fact very good. Recommended.
reviews.author: Everard Edwards

reviews.title: excellent app however the GPS position needs edit function
reviews.comment: Purchased a week ago and very happy to date with the exception of currently there is no ability for GPS logging add/edit after the event. Currently a bird sighting / recording needs to be logged onsite as against  \"off site\" at a later date. We don\'t always carry the device on which the app is installed and therefore currently unable to add / edit  later. Fix this and the star rating has to be 5 which I would like to give it but cant until this feature is added.
reviews.author: Graeme M

reviews.title: Very good first edition
reviews.comment: I have used all the Australian bird field guides in the field over many years. This is the first of those guides to be put into an Android app format. As such it is very useful in the field. Taking along my Nexus 7 is much easier and lighter than any of the books. In addition the app has bird song and calls, which is much more useful than sound descriptions in a book. Comments on the actual guide. The illustrations are weak, weaker than any other Australian guide. But they are still useful. The range maps a
reviews.author: Paul Eagles

reviews.title: Worth the coin
reviews.comment: We\'ll worth it. The audio is absolutely brilliant and complimentary to the fantastic information and images.
reviews.author: Ben Smith

reviews.title: Tony
reviews.comment: took 3 tries to install,  but all looks good now.  Looking forward to using this app
reviews.author: Tony Brain

reviews.title: Bob B
reviews.comment: Very good work. Easy to use although a little bird knowledge to start with is handy. Confirmation of sightings by recorded voice calls is an excellent feature.
reviews.author: Bob Barford

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Nice app, would be perfect if you can attach your own photos to my list
reviews.author: Michael Randall

reviews.comment: Before updating export your bird list to a file. After updating import the file. If you lost you list, uninstall update go to backup folder run .apk
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: My Lists have gone, too
reviews.comment: Morcombes Birds is in daily use - but I have just lost my list too.  Help.  Someone suggested importing the list with AusBirds_Auto_Backup - however, being a bit illiterate in these things I cant manage to do that.  Help!
reviews.author: Susan Margaret

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.comment: Since latest update this is a fantastic app. One suggestion is to allow linking to ( within My List) photos taken by the user. This would make it almost perfect. Well done to all involved.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Oh God, my list is gone!!!
reviews.comment: This app got my 7 year old son into birdwatching and for the last 6 months we\'ve been logging our sightings with this app, but now the list is gone! My son is going to be shattered. Please tell me I can get it back. Help
reviews.author: Hans Andersen

reviews.title: Fantastic
reviews.comment: Every thing about this app is great, it deserves more then 5 stars. The drawings of the birds are great,almost as good as pictures. I don\'t know why others  are complaining,they obviously don\'t know how to use this app as intended. I would pay up to 50$ for this app,it is much better then a field guide.
reviews.author: Nat Y

reviews.title: Great learning tool for students
reviews.comment: Great app, easy navigation, would be flawless if photo uploads were possible
reviews.author: Christos Cannizzaro

reviews.title: My Lists Have Gone!
reviews.comment: This is a great app but unless I am missing something after the latest update all my historical bird lists have been deleted, please help?
reviews.author: Alec Percival

reviews.title: Galaxy S2
reviews.comment: Worth every penny when you\'re on the go. Maybe in future the drawings of the birds could be replaced with real HD photos to show their exact colours.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Some features missing
reviews.comment: Installed on Acer A500 Android 4.0.3. Great app but cannot seem to find some features such as Compare. Oops, just worked out how to use Compare function.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: MIssing data from app
reviews.comment: I purchased this app mid 2011 for use on Android phone.  Felt it was a bit light on with bird types etc and then saw a friend\'s app on exactly the same phone type and also downloaded in 2011. His app however had twice as many bird types listed.  eg: my app lists 3 types of bowerbirds, his lists at least 7!  How do I find why my app for which I paid the same amount is so deficient in detail?
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: interested user
reviews.comment: The compare function does not work on HTC desire on the latest update, but really love the update otherwise.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Expensive!
reviews.comment: Positive:  *) I like the idea of a birding app, especially the addition of bird sounds is a big plus. The drawings of the birds are clear. Negative: *) PRICE! Way too expensive for an app *) The drawings of the locations are... wel... childish-like. I expect more from such an app.  Suggestions: *) It would be great if you could flip through the \'birds\' (pages) with a tablet, the same as you would browse a book to look at pictures. *) If you log a sighting, to automatically use the current date, and location (using GPS) *) The screen is divided into two frames, one with the bird and one with information. It would be nice if you could compare birds with each other.
reviews.author: A Google User
